newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-AJAX BEAT ATLETICO 3-2 AFTER EXTRA TIME.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-AJAX BEAT ATLETICO 3-2 AFTER EXTRA TIME.

text.p: Last season's runners-up Ajax reached the semifinals of the European Cup after beating Atletico Madrid 3-2 after extra-time on Wednesday for a 4-3 aggregate victory.
But the four-times champions had keeper Edwin van der Sar to thank for dramatic victory as he made several great saves including one from a penalty.
Atletico were led throughout by a spirited Kiko and it was the striker who rounded off a fine move down the right to open the scoring just before the half-hour.

A defensive error let through Ronald de Boer to head the equaliser just after the break, and a splendid strike by substitute forward Dani put the Dutch ahead early in extra-time after van der Sar had saved a penalty from Juan Eduardo Esnaider in the 75th minute.
Milinko Pantic made it 2-2 from another penalty, but with Atletico needing another goal, Tijani Babangida broke through to score a late winner.
